text: Is there any spatial Gillespie simulation implementation in the diffeq ecosystem?

elements.text: Is there any spatial Gillespie simulation implementation in the diffeq ecosystem?

text: not yet. You'd have to build it from Catalyst.jl directly. Though <@UFTJ2UDEW> is working towards this kind of thing.

elements.text: not yet. You'd have to build it from Catalyst.jl directly. Though
is working towards this kind of thing.

text: There’s a DiffEqJump PR that flattens spatial systems to a big list of reactions, but that isn’t going to be the best approach (though RSSACR can work well here we’ve found in limited testing). We’re missing optimizations to reduce memory use by the dependency graphs that are needed for big graphs/meshes though. This will hopefully get a big push this summer as we have a student interested in working on it if we can get funding, and I’ll hopefully be on sabbatical as of mid-May, so have more time too. If this interests you we’d love to get help with it though over in DiffEqJump.

elements.text: There’s a DiffEqJump PR that flattens spatial systems to a big list of reactions, but that isn’t going to be the best approach (though RSSACR can work well here we’ve found in limited testing). We’re missing optimizations to reduce memory use by the dependency graphs that are needed for big graphs/meshes though. This will hopefully get a big push this summer as we have a student interested in working on it if we can get funding, and I’ll hopefully be on sabbatical as of mid-May, so have more time too. If this interests you we’d love to get help with it though over in DiffEqJump.

text: So short answer is you can do it by just making a big list of jumps, but we’re lacking spatially optimized methods like the next sub volume method.

elements.text: So short answer is you can do it by just making a big list of jumps, but we’re lacking spatially optimized methods like the next sub volume method.

text: I'd be happy to help! I used to work on this stuff a while ago and would love to get more involved with it again.

elements.text: I'd be happy to help! I used to work on this stuff a while ago and would love to get more involved with it again.

text: If you take a look at the aggregators in DiffEqJump you can see how we’ve done the non-spatial systems.
